blog.name: ao3feed-junghope
blog.title: Bright Sun, Little Star
blog.description: This blog is an AUTOMATED blog that uses an IFTTT algorithm to instantly post fics posted under the relationship: Jeon Jungkook/Jung Hoseok | J-Hope tag on ao3. The owner of this blog (hoseokie-jung) only logs in to delete things that don't belong (rp requests, other ships, etc) once every couple of months because she has a terrible memory and forgets that this is, in fact, her blog.

summary: My eyes teared up as I looked up at them, shaking where I stood, "No!", it was supposed to come out demanding but instead it...
question: My eyes teared up as I looked up at them, shaking where I stood, "No!", it was supposed to come out demanding but instead it came out scared. Throwing the envelope of money at their feet, "That's all I h-have, please.", I beg, trying to keep from sobbing, I just wanted my family to be safe.
answer: Jimin knelt down on the floor and picked up the money off of the floor and handed it to his hyung. Yoongi opened up the envelope and check the amount of money inside. He looked back up at you. “This is only a fraction of what your brother owes, you realize that, right?”

reblog.comment: Jimin knelt down on the floor and picked up the money off of the floor and handed it to his hyung. Yoongi opened up the envelope and check the amount of money inside. He looked back up at you. “This is only a fraction of what your brother owes, you realize that, right?”

summary: SRK Part 3- This Isn’t So Bad
title: SRK Part 3- This Isn’t So Bad
body:
~Super Rich Kids~

Part Three - This isn’t so Bad
Master List in bio

Genre:  Humor, fluff, smol angst

Pairing: Namjoon x Reader

Before you can scream, one hand covers your mouth while the other forces you to turn around.
“REMI!” Your squeal is muffled by her hand. She doesn’t bother answering you as she’s peering around the bookshelf she pulled you behind.
“Okay. I’m going to forgive you for not texting me, even though I’ve been wondering where you’ve been, because wow. Who the HELL ARE THOSE GUYS?” Remi’s eyes were practically bulging out of her head, and you could see her face reddening as realization continued to seep in. “You just waltz into here like it’s completely normal that you’re with four strange dudes, sorry, four extremely hot strange dudes. I need deets, and I need them now, because I am going to have to go over there and do my godforsaken job, and I can’t believe you have just betrayed me like this. MY OWN BEST FRIEND.” You wiggled free from her grasp and grabbed her shoulders. 
“Deep breath girl, I know, I didn’t want to spring them on you like this, but it’s been a DAY. I made a fool out of myself in class this morning, and Jimin wanted me to hang out, and I couldn’t just say no to him, YOU SEE THESE MEN. YOU SEE WHAT THEY LOOK LIKE. I COULDN’T JUST SAY NO.” The intense whispers between you and Remi were starting to concern the surrounding customers, who were just trying to find a good book and you were clearly in the way -insert eye roll.

             The two of you peeked around the bookcase to see what the guys were doing. They were spread out in the plush chairs, looking completely at home. You couldn’t hear what they were talking about, but Jimin was doubled over laughing, while Jin was shaking his head angrily at Jungkook, who was just shrugging. Taehyung looked like he wanted nothing to do with the mess unfolding before him. You looked back to Remi to find her starting to sink inside the sweater she was wearing.
“I can’t do this. I’m turtling. I’m going to turtle!” Remi squeaked and hid half her face.
“They’re really nice, I swear! Also, this is only four out of seven…”
“SEVEN?! ARE THE OTHERS COMING HERE TOO?”
“No, no don’t worry about it,” Your mind instantly went to the missing three, and you scrunched your face as you thought of Namjoon. Would he even be able to relax like the rest of them? You couldn’t imagine him being able to joke around and be goofy when he looked so damn stuffy and high maintenance. Remi stared at you quizzically, watching you get lost in your thoughts. You shook your head. “The others are busy. And who knows, this might be the only time we see these guys. Once they realize how much of a loser I am, they’ll lose interest.” Remi smacked your arm. 
“You are not a loser. And I can’t believe I’m saying this but get over there. I’m going to spend another minute taking some deep breaths and finding my zen before I come out to grab your orders.”

             Remi shoved you away, and you stumbled, knocking one of the tables and smacking your shin. You sighed in pain, why were you always so clumsy?
“Y/N! Are you okay? Did you hurt yourself?” Jimin called from his chair, looking deeply concerned. You knew if you said yes, he would most likely bolt right over and start cooing over you, so you shook your head no and walked over to the group. You noticed right away that there wasn’t a chair for you. The disappointment must’ve showed on your face, because Jimin leaned towards you, his expression changing to a sly grin. “There weren’t any chairs left to fit all of us, so you can just sit on my lap.” Before you even had time to protest, Jimin had pulled you down and you fell on top of him. His hands went to the spot where you had hit the table and he gently caressed your leg. “Oh, baby girl, you did hurt yourself.”

             Every part of you that touched Jimin lit on fire. Feelings that you couldn’t quite put a name to were overwhelming you and all you wanted to do was scream and run and hide in a corner until you could get a hold of yourself. Jin, Jungkook and Taehyung all stared in your direction, making you even more uncomfortable than you already were. The only solution you could come up with was to hide your face in your hands.
“Y/N? You can sit between Jin and I, there’s enough room. You don’t have to give in to this thirsty boy’s shenanigans.” Jungkook suggested, and you flipped yourself off of Jimin and dove into the small spot between the two larger guys.
“Kookie, that wasn’t nice, and I am not thirsty! You are giving Y/N the wrong ideas about me!” Jimin started complaining, his full lips turning into a frown. He sunk back into his chair with displeasure.
“I’m giving her the wrong ideas? I have never laid eyes on such filth.”
“Yikes.” You blurted out, your hands still covering your face. Jin gently punched you on the arm amused. You peeked from your hands and gave Jin a small smile. You could still hear Jimin grumbling and huffing across from you, his knees pulled to his chest.

             “Hey, uh, excuse me.” Remi was standing beside the five of you, her notebook out. She looked at you, and only you. “Are you ready to order?”
Wanting to move the attention to someone else, you decided to tell the guys that she was your best friend that you had mentioned earlier. The guys immediately lit up with excitement, throwing compliments at her along with their coffee orders. You watched her carefully, noticing her voice become quieter and she started sinking into her sweater again. You leaned over Jin and grabbed her hand.

“Ignore these fools,” you whispered, trying to send her positive vibes and encouragement.
“Remi!” Taehyung shouted, “You should hang out with us sometime! We would love to see you and Y/N together as a duo. I feel like you would fit in perfectly with us. If you weren’t working, I would say join us now, but, y’know.”
“Uh, yeah, maybe next time. I’m going to put your orders in and then I’ve got some stuff to do in the back. It was really nice to meet you, you’re all so… enjoyable. Y/N, girl, text me later.” Remi shuffled away, and you knew she was at her limit of handling the situation.  You looked back to the guys, wondering how you got yourself into this mess.

             A different server brought your drinks to the table, and you knew you wouldn’t see Remi again for the rest of your time here. You grabbed your mug, taking a long sip. Caffeine would help. It always helped and right now it felt like a lifeline that you were desperately clinging to. Besides, you still had another class to get through before you could finally call it a day and go home. The five of you were getting along so well. Jin making awful puns, causing you to punch him numerous times in disgust, Jungkook calling out Jimin every time he tried to make even a slight move on you, Jimin pouting for 75% of the time, Taehyung giving everyone fashion advice and showing off his photo shoot pictures. It was a beautiful sight to behold. The more you talked, the more you felt a bond forming between you guys. You thought about the ones that weren’t there, and a small pang rang through you. You wanted to get to know them as well, and maybe you would eventually. The guys all seemed extremely close, so there was a definite chance you would be hanging out with all of them some time.

             You looked at your phone for the first time in a while, only to be met with the time staring you in the face once again.
“FOR REAL?!”
You started grabbing for your bag, trying to get yourself together. The guys looked at each other in confusion, before realization crossed their faces.
“SHIT. YOU HAVE CLASS. WE HAVE CLASS.” Jin screamed, flying out of his seat. The others followed suit and soon enough you were all screaming goodbye to Remi, who was still in the back, and flying out of the coffee shop. The five of you ran all the way back to the school, screaming goodbyes and continuing on. A part of you felt a sense of relief, finally being on your own again, and the other part of you was upset you didn’t even get any of their numbers. Your phone pinged, and you had a twitter notification. Somehow, they had found your twitter. Already. 
Jimin probably found it first.
You were too busy looking at your phone, that you hadn’t noticed yourself approaching a tall figure, rather quickly.

             Your entire body collided with the person and soon enough, you found yourself on top of said human. A whimper escaped your mouth as the other person wheezed.
“Oh my God, I am so sorry. I wasn’t paying attention, this is all my fault-”
“You’re damn right this is your fault. Why weren’t you watching where you were-”
The two of you stopped as soon as you realized who the other was. You quickly got up and brushed yourself off, your face brightening. 
Why him? Why him? Why me? Why now?

It looked like Namjoon was thinking the exact same thing as you. His face soured and he crossed his arms, and you couldn’t help but notice a faint blush staining his cheeks.
He’s embarrassed.
Your blood started to heat at the sight of something so adorable, and you tried to push it down, but it wasn’t happening.
“S-sorry.” You stuttered, looking at your feet. 
How could this happen twice now? Was this fate? Was destiny trying to make you mortal enemies?
“It’s fine.” He replied curtly.
“A-alright, I’ll, uh, continue to class then. S-sorry again. I didn’t mean to ruin your day twice…”
You grabbed the edges of your shorts, put your head down and tried your hardest to just walk past him, but he grabbed your arm to stop you.

             Your eyes widened and you looked up at him. His sunglasses were on his head now and you could really see what he looked like. You felt a blush rising in you, but you couldn’t move. The wind played through his hair, and your heart skipped. His lips were slightly parted, as if he was trying to figure out what to say to you. You saw the darkness under his eyes, he looked barely functional. That was probably why he had been wearing sunglasses. You instantly felt all the annoyance and anger leave your body, and every inch of you wanted to wrap him in your arms and tell him it would be okay. You could feel the weight he was carrying just by looking at him. As if he felt you reading him, he let go of your arm and put his sunglasses back on. He took a couple steps before turning his head to the side.
“You… you didn’t ruin my day.”
It was as if his voice carried on the wind. It was barely audible, but you heard it. Your feet were still frozen in place, and you watched him walk away.

             You instantly thought of the things the guys had mentioned earlier. How whatever Namjoon and the other two were working on was some sort of secret. You had no idea what it could possibly be, but it was clearly taking a toll on him, and as you walked the rest of the way to class you found yourself thinking of ways to cheer him up.

reblog.comment:
~Super Rich Kids~

You knew if you said yes, he would most likely bolt right over and start cooing over you, so you shook your head no and walked over to the group. You noticed right away that there wasn’t a chair for you. The disappointment must’ve showed on your face, because Jimin leaned towards you, his expression changing to a sly grin. “There weren’t any chairs left to fit all of us, so you can just sit on my lap.” Before you even had time to protest, Jimin had pulled you down and you fell on top of him. His hands went to the spot where you had hit the table and he gently caressed your leg. “Oh, baby girl, you did hurt yourself.”

             Every part of you that touched Jimin lit on fire. Feelings that you couldn’t quite put a name to were overwhelming you and all you wanted to do was scream and run and hide in a corner until you could get a hold of yourself. Jin, Jungkook and Taehyung all stared in your direction, making you even more uncomfortable than you already were. The only solution you could come up with was to hide your face in your hands.
“Y/N? You can sit between Jin and I, there’s enough room. You don’t have to give in to this thirsty boy’s shenanigans.” Jungkook suggested, and you flipped yourself off of Jimin and dove into the small spot between the two larger guys.
“Kookie, that wasn’t nice, and I am not thirsty! You are giving Y/N the wrong ideas about me!” Jimin started complaining, his full lips turning into a frown. He sunk back into his chair with displeasure.
“I’m giving her the wrong ideas? I have never laid eyes on such filth.”
“Yikes.” You blurted out, your hands still covering your face. Jin gently punched you on the arm amused. You peeked from your hands and gave Jin a small smile. You could still hear Jimin grumbling and huffing across from you, his knees pulled to his chest.

             “Hey, uh, excuse me.” Remi was standing beside the five of you, her notebook out. She looked at you, and only you. “Are you ready to order?”
Wanting to move the attention to someone else, you decided to tell the guys that she was your best friend that you had mentioned earlier. The guys immediately lit up with excitement, throwing compliments at her along with their coffee orders. You watched her carefully, noticing her voice become quieter and she started sinking into her sweater again. You leaned over Jin and grabbed her hand.

“Ignore these fools,” you whispered, trying to send her positive vibes and encouragement.
“Remi!” Taehyung shouted, “You should hang out with us sometime! We would love to see you and Y/N together as a duo. I feel like you would fit in perfectly with us. If you weren’t working, I would say join us now, but, y’know.”
“Uh, yeah, maybe next time. I’m going to put your orders in and then I’ve got some stuff to do in the back. It was really nice to meet you, you’re all so… enjoyable. Y/N, girl, text me later.” Remi shuffled away, and you knew she was at her limit of handling the situation.  You looked back to the guys, wondering how you got yourself into this mess.

             A different server brought your drinks to the table, and you knew you wouldn’t see Remi again for the rest of your time here. You grabbed your mug, taking a long sip. Caffeine would help. It always helped and right now it felt like a lifeline that you were desperately clinging to. Besides, you still had another class to get through before you could finally call it a day and go home. The five of you were getting along so well. Jin making awful puns, causing you to punch him numerous times in disgust, Jungkook calling out Jimin every time he tried to make even a slight move on you, Jimin pouting for 75% of the time, Taehyung giving everyone fashion advice and showing off his photo shoot pictures. It was a beautiful sight to behold. The more you talked, the more you felt a bond forming between you guys. You thought about the ones that weren’t there, and a small pang rang through you. You wanted to get to know them as well, and maybe you would eventually. The guys all seemed extremely close, so there was a definite chance you would be hanging out with all of them some time.

             You looked at your phone for the first time in a while, only to be met with the time staring you in the face once again.
“FOR REAL?!”
You started grabbing for your bag, trying to get yourself together. The guys looked at each other in confusion, before realization crossed their faces.
“SHIT. YOU HAVE CLASS. WE HAVE CLASS.” Jin screamed, flying out of his seat. The others followed suit and soon enough you were all screaming goodbye to Remi, who was still in the back, and flying out of the coffee shop. The five of you ran all the way back to the school, screaming goodbyes and continuing on. A part of you felt a sense of relief, finally being on your own again, and the other part of you was upset you didn’t even get any of their numbers. Your phone pinged, and you had a twitter notification. Somehow, they had found your twitter. Already. 
Jimin probably found it first.
You were too busy looking at your phone, that you hadn’t noticed yourself approaching a tall figure, rather quickly.

             Your entire body collided with the person and soon enough, you found yourself on top of said human. A whimper escaped your mouth as the other person wheezed.
“Oh my God, I am so sorry. I wasn’t paying attention, this is all my fault-”
“You’re damn right this is your fault. Why weren’t you watching where you were-”
The two of you stopped as soon as you realized who the other was. You quickly got up and brushed yourself off, your face brightening. 
Why him? Why him? Why me? Why now?

It looked like Namjoon was thinking the exact same thing as you. His face soured and he crossed his arms, and you couldn’t help but notice a faint blush staining his cheeks.
He’s embarrassed.
Your blood started to heat at the sight of something so adorable, and you tried to push it down, but it wasn’t happening.
“S-sorry.” You stuttered, looking at your feet. 
How could this happen twice now? Was this fate? Was destiny trying to make you mortal enemies?
“It’s fine.” He replied curtly.
“A-alright, I’ll, uh, continue to class then. S-sorry again. I didn’t mean to ruin your day twice…”
You grabbed the edges of your shorts, put your head down and tried your hardest to just walk past him, but he grabbed your arm to stop you.

             Your eyes widened and you looked up at him. His sunglasses were on his head now and you could really see what he looked like. You felt a blush rising in you, but you couldn’t move. The wind played through his hair, and your heart skipped. His lips were slightly parted, as if he was trying to figure out what to say to you. You saw the darkness under his eyes, he looked barely functional. That was probably why he had been wearing sunglasses. You instantly felt all the annoyance and anger leave your body, and every inch of you wanted to wrap him in your arms and tell him it would be okay. You could feel the weight he was carrying just by looking at him. As if he felt you reading him, he let go of your arm and put his sunglasses back on. He took a couple steps before turning his head to the side.
“You… you didn’t ruin my day.”
It was as if his voice carried on the wind. It was barely audible, but you heard it. Your feet were still frozen in place, and you watched him walk away.

             You instantly thought of the things the guys had mentioned earlier. How whatever Namjoon and the other two were working on was some sort of secret. You had no idea what it could possibly be, but it was clearly taking a toll on him, and as you walked the rest of the way to class you found yourself thinking of ways to cheer him up.

trail.content_raw:
~Super Rich Kids~

Part Three - This isn’t so Bad
Master List in bio

Genre:  Humor, fluff, smol angst

Pairing: Namjoon x Reader

Before you can scream, one hand covers your mouth while the other forces you to turn around.
“REMI!” Your squeal is muffled by her hand. She doesn’t bother answering you as she’s peering around the bookshelf she pulled you behind.
“Okay. I’m going to forgive you for not texting me, even though I’ve been wondering where you’ve been, because wow. Who the HELL ARE THOSE GUYS?” Remi’s eyes were practically bulging out of her head, and you could see her face reddening as realization continued to seep in. “You just waltz into here like it’s completely normal that you’re with four strange dudes, sorry, four extremely hot strange dudes. I need deets, and I need them now, because I am going to have to go over there and do my godforsaken job, and I can’t believe you have just betrayed me like this. MY OWN BEST FRIEND.” You wiggled free from her grasp and grabbed her shoulders. 
“Deep breath girl, I know, I didn’t want to spring them on you like this, but it’s been a DAY. I made a fool out of myself in class this morning, and Jimin wanted me to hang out, and I couldn’t just say no to him, YOU SEE THESE MEN. YOU SEE WHAT THEY LOOK LIKE. I COULDN’T JUST SAY NO.” The intense whispers between you and Remi were starting to concern the surrounding customers, who were just trying to find a good book and you were clearly in the way -insert eye roll.

             The two of you peeked around the bookcase to see what the guys were doing. They were spread out in the plush chairs, looking completely at home. You couldn’t hear what they were talking about, but Jimin was doubled over laughing, while Jin was shaking his head angrily at Jungkook, who was just shrugging. Taehyung looked like he wanted nothing to do with the mess unfolding before him. You looked back to Remi to find her starting to sink inside the sweater she was wearing.
“I can’t do this. I’m turtling. I’m going to turtle!” Remi squeaked and hid half her face.
“They’re really nice, I swear! Also, this is only four out of seven…”
“SEVEN?! ARE THE OTHERS COMING HERE TOO?”
“No, no don’t worry about it,” Your mind instantly went to the missing three, and you scrunched your face as you thought of Namjoon. Would he even be able to relax like the rest of them? You couldn’t imagine him being able to joke around and be goofy when he looked so damn stuffy and high maintenance. Remi stared at you quizzically, watching you get lost in your thoughts. You shook your head. “The others are busy. And who knows, this might be the only time we see these guys. Once they realize how much of a loser I am, they’ll lose interest.” Remi smacked your arm. 
“You are not a loser. And I can’t believe I’m saying this but get over there. I’m going to spend another minute taking some deep breaths and finding my zen before I come out to grab your orders.”

             Remi shoved you away, and you stumbled, knocking one of the tables and smacking your shin. You sighed in pain, why were you always so clumsy?
“Y/N! Are you okay? Did you hurt yourself?” Jimin called from his chair, looking deeply concerned. You knew if you said yes, he would most likely bolt right over and start cooing over you, so you shook your head no and walked over to the group. You noticed right away that there wasn’t a chair for you. The disappointment must’ve showed on your face, because Jimin leaned towards you, his expression changing to a sly grin. “There weren’t any chairs left to fit all of us, so you can just sit on my lap.” Before you even had time to protest, Jimin had pulled you down and you fell on top of him. His hands went to the spot where you had hit the table and he gently caressed your leg. “Oh, baby girl, you did hurt yourself.”

             Every part of you that touched Jimin lit on fire. Feelings that you couldn’t quite put a name to were overwhelming you and all you wanted to do was scream and run and hide in a corner until you could get a hold of yourself. Jin, Jungkook and Taehyung all stared in your direction, making you even more uncomfortable than you already were. The only solution you could come up with was to hide your face in your hands.
“Y/N? You can sit between Jin and I, there’s enough room. You don’t have to give in to this thirsty boy’s shenanigans.” Jungkook suggested, and you flipped yourself off of Jimin and dove into the small spot between the two larger guys.
“Kookie, that wasn’t nice, and I am not thirsty! You are giving Y/N the wrong ideas about me!” Jimin started complaining, his full lips turning into a frown. He sunk back into his chair with displeasure.
“I’m giving her the wrong ideas? I have never laid eyes on such filth.”
“Yikes.” You blurted out, your hands still covering your face. Jin gently punched you on the arm amused. You peeked from your hands and gave Jin a small smile. You could still hear Jimin grumbling and huffing across from you, his knees pulled to his chest.

             “Hey, uh, excuse me.” Remi was standing beside the five of you, her notebook out. She looked at you, and only you. “Are you ready to order?”
Wanting to move the attention to someone else, you decided to tell the guys that she was your best friend that you had mentioned earlier. The guys immediately lit up with excitement, throwing compliments at her along with their coffee orders. You watched her carefully, noticing her voice become quieter and she started sinking into her sweater again. You leaned over Jin and grabbed her hand.

“Ignore these fools,” you whispered, trying to send her positive vibes and encouragement.
“Remi!” Taehyung shouted, “You should hang out with us sometime! We would love to see you and Y/N together as a duo. I feel like you would fit in perfectly with us. If you weren’t working, I would say join us now, but, y’know.”
“Uh, yeah, maybe next time. I’m going to put your orders in and then I’ve got some stuff to do in the back. It was really nice to meet you, you’re all so… enjoyable. Y/N, girl, text me later.” Remi shuffled away, and you knew she was at her limit of handling the situation.  You looked back to the guys, wondering how you got yourself into this mess.

             A different server brought your drinks to the table, and you knew you wouldn’t see Remi again for the rest of your time here. You grabbed your mug, taking a long sip. Caffeine would help. It always helped and right now it felt like a lifeline that you were desperately clinging to. Besides, you still had another class to get through before you could finally call it a day and go home. The five of you were getting along so well. Jin making awful puns, causing you to punch him numerous times in disgust, Jungkook calling out Jimin every time he tried to make even a slight move on you, Jimin pouting for 75% of the time, Taehyung giving everyone fashion advice and showing off his photo shoot pictures. It was a beautiful sight to behold. The more you talked, the more you felt a bond forming between you guys. You thought about the ones that weren’t there, and a small pang rang through you. You wanted to get to know them as well, and maybe you would eventually. The guys all seemed extremely close, so there was a definite chance you would be hanging out with all of them some time.

             You looked at your phone for the first time in a while, only to be met with the time staring you in the face once again.
“FOR REAL?!”
You started grabbing for your bag, trying to get yourself together. The guys looked at each other in confusion, before realization crossed their faces.
“SHIT. YOU HAVE CLASS. WE HAVE CLASS.” Jin screamed, flying out of his seat. The others followed suit and soon enough you were all screaming goodbye to Remi, who was still in the back, and flying out of the coffee shop. The five of you ran all the way back to the school, screaming goodbyes and continuing on. A part of you felt a sense of relief, finally being on your own again, and the other part of you was upset you didn’t even get any of their numbers. Your phone pinged, and you had a twitter notification. Somehow, they had found your twitter. Already. 
Jimin probably found it first.
You were too busy looking at your phone, that you hadn’t noticed yourself approaching a tall figure, rather quickly.

             Your entire body collided with the person and soon enough, you found yourself on top of said human. A whimper escaped your mouth as the other person wheezed.
“Oh my God, I am so sorry. I wasn’t paying attention, this is all my fault-”
“You’re damn right this is your fault. Why weren’t you watching where you were-”
The two of you stopped as soon as you realized who the other was. You quickly got up and brushed yourself off, your face brightening. 
Why him? Why him? Why me? Why now?

It looked like Namjoon was thinking the exact same thing as you. His face soured and he crossed his arms, and you couldn’t help but notice a faint blush staining his cheeks.
He’s embarrassed.
Your blood started to heat at the sight of something so adorable, and you tried to push it down, but it wasn’t happening.

How could this happen twice now? Was this fate? Was destiny trying to make you mortal enemies?

The wind played through his hair, and your heart skipped. His lips were slightly parted, as if he was trying to figure out what to say to you. You instantly felt all the annoyance and anger leave your body, and every inch of you wanted to wrap him in your arms and tell him it would be okay. You could feel the weight he was carrying just by looking at him. As if he felt you reading him, he let go of your arm and put his sunglasses back on. He took a couple steps before turning his head to the side.
“You… you didn’t ruin my day.”
It was as if his voice carried on the wind. It was barely audible, but you heard it. Your feet were still frozen in place, and you watched him walk away.

             You instantly thought of the things the guys had mentioned earlier. How whatever Namjoon and the other two were working on was some sort of secret. You had no idea what it could possibly be, but it was clearly taking a toll on him, and as you walked the rest of the way to class you found yourself thinking of ways to cheer him up.

blog.name: taesbabygirl96
blog.title: kpop trash 🇰🇷
blog.description: GR. she/her. Multifandom but mostly BTS. Taehyung and Yoongi biased. yoonmin💞.
